Author: scubapanda#2485
Content: OK, so how does 1,5m vs 25m PIRATE vs KMD difficulty translate to hashrate?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: 75% of KMD's "hashrate" is notary nodes easy mining

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content: Difficulty adjustment is related to the last blocks mined times, it differs from many coins but are the same for all ac's and are not directly corellated with hashrate (especially with a early chain with so much fluctuations in hashrate)

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content: All this to say pirate has is own hashrate

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content: Independent of KMD

Author: scubapanda#2485

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I think there may be a bug in how komodod limits coinbase txs. Need to do some more testing, but it *seems* like if you claim more than 256 in the coinbase, it can't have multiple outputs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there are indeed some restrictions with coinbases having lots of outputs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @webworker01 z_sendmany is async, as you probably know, but also, z_sendmany locks some notes (the zaddr equiv of utxos)

Author: Alright#0419
Content: even with 2 outputs it was rejecting blocks for me

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @webworker01 my guess is some operation of yours is trying to use notes that being used by z_sendmany, and are locked/etc

Author: Alright#0419
Content: the reason I think that is because I was sending t -> t transactions with 0 coin output then trying to claim the inputs in the coinbase

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for pools you need to fiddle with the txfees

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: basically you need to assume txfees are zero if making multiple coinbase vouts

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it worked with single output coinbase txs, but if I added a second, it rejects the blocks

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yep

Author: Alright#0419
Content: exactly what I'm saying

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is technically a bug, but changing it would require hardforking

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: subtract out the txfees

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then it will work

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: sounds better to call it a feature

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @webworker01 z_shieldcoinbase and z_mergetoaddress do the same stuff

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just pretend the txfees are 0, ie. that there is only blockreward

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then it should work to allocate the coinbase across vouts

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @webworker01 this stuff doesn't matter much with taddrs, stuff is so fast. but with zaddrs, many operations run into locks from other slow operations
